channel.title: How many languages do you know?
channel.description:
[size=18pt]♠[/size]First Don't put a language unless you trully know it.[size=18pt]♠[/size] (that means if all you know how to do, with lets say Java is a RSPS and where you only mess with a few cgf files change some names and other things. without really making some of you own code your do not know that language.)
[s]Me I know 3 languages (soon to be 4, I am learning php right now). HTML, Java, and CSS.[/s] Okay I know 1, Java. I also know HTML and CSS but as they are not "proper" languages they do not count. All this said how many do you know?

item.title: How many languages do you know?
item.dc:creator: @Kaex Kaex
item.description:
@Kaex wrote:

2, Java and C lol :o. Failz :mad:

Read full topic
item.source: How many languages do you know?

item.title: How many languages do you know?
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”][quote author=meiscooldude link=topic=467151.msg3440982#msg3440982 date=1293079143]
I believe there is a strong difference between knowing the name of something, and KNOWING something. I’ve written code in many different languages/scripts/markups. To name a few: C, C++, C#, Java, PHP, Javascript, SQL, Perl, Python, CSS, HTML, XHTML, XML, XSD, XSL-FO, XSL-T, Assembly, and Brain Fuck among several others. But I can’t (and won’t) say I KNOW a language.

IMO to say one KNOWS a language implies one knows everything from syntax, to how it gets to machine code.

So… I know none.

[/quote]That is probably the most intelligent post I’ve seen on here for months. :P[/quote]Pretty much the same thing a few other people have said in this topic lol

Read full topic
item.source: How many languages do you know?

IMO to say one KNOWS a language implies one knows everything from syntax, to how it gets to machine code.

So… I know none.

No… Ive seen others that are intelligent, it’s just this one was the only one you were bothered to read.

item.title: How many languages do you know?
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”][quote author=RuneSpace link=topic=467151.msg3438147#msg3438147 date=1292909810]

Korean & English

I think this is programming languages, not verbal lol. If we want to go verbal, I know English, and bits/peices of German and Spanish.

Mi no hablo espanole, tu hablo ingles? (yes i know there are spelling mistakes, my teacher for spanish told me to go to sleep after my mom was cussing at her on the phone. Dumb broad tried to tell my mom Americans need to learn spanish, since there are soo many Mexicans here.

Stupid bitch.

Mexicans are minorities for a reason…
[/quote]Technically Caucasians are more of a minority.[/quote]
Depends on how you look at it.

Read full topic
item.source: How many languages do you know?

item.title: How many languages do you know?
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“Sanskrit, post:38, topic:371064”][quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=467151.msg3436963#msg3436963 date=1292815125]

Spanish is the main language… in the world. As in, the most popular. (I ignore the chinese because that is mostly focused around one country, rather limited scope, despite it technically being easily the most popular).

MAYBE YOU SHOULD LEARN IT IF YOU LIVE IN THIS WORLD

Won’t ever learn another language. Ignorant you say? Yes, but that is just because, in my local area there is only 1 spanish speaking family, only one of them speaks english, the daughter. She has to translate everthing. She has tried teacher her mom and dad some, but they refuse. That is the kind of issue that is the reason I wont learn. If i go to an area where their MAIN language is spanish, then yes, i will learn it, but until then, no.
[/quote]

Wtf are they gonna do when she wants to move out?[/quote]
Ironic part is, she is moving out, 8 months from now. She’s got a home bought last time I herd, but is painting it and getting furniture.

Read full topic
item.source: How many languages do you know?

item.title: How many languages do you know?
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“Thug-life, post:32, topic:371064”][quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=467151.msg3429834#msg3429834 date=1292231841]
I’d rather die than be forced to learn a language because someone refuses to learn our language after moving here.
[/quote]

You do realise people were speaking Spanish in America long before the English colonised it? Right?[/quote]
English is the main language now? I don’t care about history, is no way to change what happened. All I am saying, is that they move here willingly, they should attempt to learn it at least. Now if they were forced here, i could understand, but I don’t see any spanish speaking people that didn’t want to be here.

Read full topic

item.title: How many languages do you know?
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“the wanderer, post:24, topic:371064”][quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=467151.msg3429834#msg3429834 date=1292231841]

Korean & English

I think this is programming languages, not verbal lol. If we want to go verbal, I know English, and bits/peices of German and Spanish.

Mi no hablo espanole, tu hablo ingles? (yes i know there are spelling mistakes, my teacher for spanish told me to go to sleep after my mom was cussing at her on the phone. Dumb broad tried to tell my mom Americans need to learn spanish, since there are soo many Mexicans here.

What are you thinking?! It’s America! Speak Spanish!

I’d rather die than be forced to learn a language because someone refuses to learn our language after moving here.
[/quote]
Haha. My thoughts exactly. Only country that tries making you learn another language because someone moves in is America. And my statement above was a joke. :P[/quote]
I know Still infuriates me that they made a foreign language required in a bunch of schools. My school had it, but i got passed that lol.
